meanings.definition: To expel gas loudly from the stomach through the mouth.
meanings.sent1: After eating too quickly, he belched loudly in class.
meanings.sent2: The man belched after drinking a fizzy soda.
meanings.sent3: The dog belched during the silent moment of the movie, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: The old car belched smoke as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: The volcano belched ash and smoke into the sky, creating a dark cloud.

meanings.definition: To emit a loud, unpleasant noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm belched thunder as the dark clouds rolled in.
meanings.sent2: The old pipes belched a strange noise in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house belched eerie sounds that sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent4: The factory chimney belched black smoke into the sky, polluting the air.
meanings.sent5: The dragon belched fire, scaring away anyone who dared to approach.
